dialogue.text: Go talk to Mr. Gély.
I know Miss De Cerjeat.
Her name is Elisabeth.

text.option: Good day! What are you buying?

dialogue.text: Greetings, how can I help you?
I have beautiful apples and turnips!
François?
Oh sorry. I thought you were someone else...
I love coming to the market!
I want to buy everything!
but I don't want to carry it all home...
I live at the brewery on Chaucrau street.
And if I do, I worry that my mother Angélique won't let me come anymore.
Oh, looks like Ms. Trüschel sent her daughter on errands again.
It is usually a domestic's job.
But I believe she wants to see the town.
The leather is not for sale, sorry!
I bought it from Mr. Mercier.
Have you read "Le Robinson suisse" by de Montolieu.
It's my favourite book.
You should be careful!
There have been many thefts lately.
They mainly steal baggage at the back of carriages.
but I heard a rumor
that someone stole an owl from a garden!
I need to hurry.
I have to take the laundry all the way back to Vennes,
to Ms. De Montolieu and her son.
I would love it if someone could do this job for me...

text.option: Come on! The beer is not going to brew itself!

dialogue.text: If you have any questions, go ask my spouse.
Hey Wolff! Do you know what happened to Ralf?
I haven't seen him for a while...
Nein, keine Ahnung...
Last time I saw him was last week,
but my memories are blurry...
We had too much to drink that night.
Brewing can be exhausting.
I am sorry, but I am very busy at the moment.
I need to finish some work,
but you can have a look at my documents on the desk upstairs.
Maybe you will find what you are looking for.
Je n'ai pas envie de vous parler...
Vous avez ruiné ma bière et brûlé ma cuve.
Allez embêter quelqu'un d'autre.
Merci beaucoup pour votre aide!
Ah mais je n'ai pas pris le temps de me présenter!
Je m'appelle Angélique Trüschel.
Avec mon époux, Conrad, nous sommes propriétaires de la brasserie.
I want to see the market too!
Our mother thinks we are too young to go out,
but our sister Frédérique, is allowed to go on errands.
Don't you think Lausanne needs more bridges?
Indeed, M. Perregaux!
What a beautiful building, don't you think?
It is the casino de Derrière-Bourg,
a concert hall for music, parties and all sorts of events.
Right here, the "casinistes" gathered
to organise the "Révolution libérale".
I forgot my briefcase somewhere...
Hi, my name is Louis Henri Bourgeois.
I was elected as a councillor
soon after the revolution that started right here in this building.
Ms Perregaux is pregnant again. She is expecting her third child.
Oh! Congratulations!
Ms Appiani, the first singer of the theatre of St. Charles of Lisbon,
will be giving a concert here on the 14th of February.
Welcome to our mill!
My name is Benedict.
My family has been living and working here
for generations.
Marie, stop playing and come help me!
Yes, these are all our children.
Even I am not sure how many we have...
Don't worry we get used to the smell of the Flon.
Don't drink from the river!
We can find animal carcasses in it.
The slaughterhouses and the tannery throw them in the water.
How long has this stranger been sleeping there?
I don't know... Should we wake him up?
Do you want to play with me?
I would rather be a chocolate maker than a miller.
Like our neighbour, Mr. Kohler.
I help my father grind cereals with the millstones.
My brother is not feeling well.
He has been sick for many days.
I'm scared he won't make it.
Bloody Flon! Only a source of sickness and disease!
*Kof kof*
Zzz...
